positive.review:
I honestly had low expectations. Absolutely blown away that a game can be so simple, yet addicting and challenging. 
If you are stuck and not sure what game to play next, Give this a shot. Insanely fun with friends,
This is the first roguelike game ive ever enjoyed.

One of the best survival games i ever played 

i dont really know how this master piece for free 

dan really did a great jod developing this game  

11/10

At first it may seem like a cheap Minecraft clone, but the more you play it, the more it feels like it's own game. My sibling recommended this game to me, so I decided it'd be worth trying. And now I can tell you it's worth trying! It's completely free and fun even by yourself (but especially fun with others). Highly recommend if you like survival games. Also if you decide to read the negative reviews, they will say the exact opposite as me (or be mad that you cant have "fun" with the mobs) so you decide whether or not it's a game for you.

dont got much to say, pretty good game, bit unoptimized for poor computers with less than 8 gbs of ram(half of mine is taken up by the gpu which doesnt exist which the ram compensates for.) but still good. surprised my computer even runs at ~17fps. much more optimized than some other games.

this is a great survival game, and it really mean it: SURVIVAL
graphic is lovely, sounds and effects, creatures too
survive mod is great
but its so hard even in easy mod
u need a big team to done it or pro players
only weakness of game is buildings that is like unfinished
compare to other games that ive played (i know that is so simple and fun game) it need to be much better and more comfort on building
for example: mobs spawn under floors or they can hit trough walls that these two r annoying.
ur tools get improve ur enemies too but u cant improve the building, it would be great if u can build stronger walls with better materials.
u cant remove ur building part ur self and had to hit that to remove that it damage other parts, i saw other games have this simple abbility (to remove ur own building parts)

this is game is nice and niche. The boss fights are very amusing, and very fun especially with a large group of friends. Overall, this is game is a very fun game that i recommend to everyone, and would rate it a 8.5/10.
I don‚Äôt even know why, but I absolutely love this damn game. Thanks for the work it‚Äôs a fun, chill pastime, and really great to play with friends.
I like about this game that it is very cool i recomend but sadly your world doesn t save unless you instal mods.

A lot of fun! played with Fiance and had blast. we had to switch to easy because its a bit fast paced. once you understand how to play you can get absurdly strong. For being a free game this has a bunch of hours of really enjoyable and rewarding time played.
I wasted 15 minutes of my life to this forsake game I trust in the lord he help fight Goblins they wont fucking leave me alone its annoying as fuck

Seems like a fun idea but im a figure it out for myself kind of person and i fully expected to die a few times figuring stuff out. With all that in mind i find myself rather irritated by the fact that I turn off the tutorial like 17 times (Again i like to figure things out for myself, but also that BEEP it makes is so bloody irritating) but no matter what it just turns itself back on as soon as i start a new run. Turn it off before starting run? BEEP blue ring in your face in that ever-annoying handholding fashion. Turn it off while mid run? Nah it doesnt go away just stays there and keeps beeping. This is entirely a personal issue and one that stems from a susceptibility to sensory overload, and i think the game itself is rather nice (I have seen many hours of videos) and could be quite fun once you actually delve into it. But for me, until the tutorial stays off permanently when i turn it off then I just cant do it. Again, game itself has wonderful charm and artstyle, so if you're not a basket case like myself then you'll probably enjoy it. Plus its free!! Thats always a plus. All in all would recommend but also please fix turning tutorial off its the entire sole reason im not going to play the game anymore.
not much content, but free and fun to play on occasion. Artifact system reminds me of risk of rain 2, but there's only one goal while ROR2 goes on infinitely

This game is fun, but DAMN it's hard as hell! The way I see it there's two sides to this game's coin, those being fun to play on easier modes and let hell loose, and challenging to beat on harder modes.

Literally the worst difficulty balancing of any game I have ever played, but I do have 40 hours in this game, so it clearly did something right. Do bear in mind that this game is extremely punishing, not in a good FromSoftware game type of way, but more of a frustrating way that makes you want to punch your monitor. The game is free, so I think you have nothing to lose by playing

This is one of the beast games I've ever played and I love it!!
I solo the game for the most part I would imagen its better with friends.
this game is so tuff but hard to play, requires a lot of experience

Muck is one of those rare games that leaves butterflies in your stomach after you've closed it. There is something magical about this game and it has brought me a level of happiness I haven't experienced since I was a child. This game isn't just about fun, it might be one of the greatest games ever created. A gentle reminder that sometimes the simplest ideas deliver the most unforgettable joy.

surprisingly it is enjoyable and fun even better when playing with friends. Time flies without you even noticing! The only downside is that it does not offer a save option for the world you build. Still, it‚Äôs a great experience overall.
Great game. I know i came out a long time ago but still a gem. I found it better to be enjoyed with friends, especially for tracking trophies.
This the best game of all time. Some of my fucking stupid friends told me rv there yet better than this think. It is not even comparable with that shit. Buy it, wont regret it...
This is the best and worst game I have ever played you can play alone or with freinds but it reallly dosent matter

Punishing game.  Can play solo.  Cant' save progress, play another day.  If you die just once, game ends, you lose everything, have to start over.  I've heard there are mods for this, not sure if those mods work with Steam.

That being said, I love the design, cows are abstract expressionist, there's a simplicity to the trees, feels like I'm walking thru a Dali painting.  

Even if you create a session to be Creative, and Easy, you will be attacked.  Eventually.  Basically, to survive, forget about creating a base, stockpiling resources.  It'll get trashed by mobs anyway. Being inside four walls won't protect you.  If not playing Creative, keep moving, get iron asap, get only enough to make better tools/weapons, abandoning anvils, tables, and just keep moving, progress as fast as possible to get to the shipwrecked boat asap.  Cuz it's easier to defend, don't get attacked as much.

Sometimes you may have to reroll, like if you start somewhere with no iron in sight.

And this is precisely the appeal of the game.  How punishing it is.  Good game for masochists.
Muck is a survival-roguelike. Collect resources, find items & build a base to survive for as long as you can.
pretty good game, still waiting for update5
basically a simple survival game with a few unique aspects (to sum this up quick)
its so funny and its challenging.
This is a very fun game, and its free. Its similar to rust, but more kid friendly, although it doesn't save your data
i would recommend this game, but only to people who are looking for a challenge or getting difficult Achievements.

This is an honest game: a mash-up of elements of several elements from other games in a fast-paced round to round format. It's completely unpretentious, very fun to play with friends and completely free.

Will it blow your mind as a game? No, nor does it try to. It's pure and simple coop fun, the kind of game you play with your mates while having some beers and a laugh.

this game is actually really good! played it for 6 hours straight the first time ive ever played it lol
Really fun if you enjoy ARK, Minecraft, Starbound, and Terraria, sometime janky controls but other than that, really fun.

here is my better review on the game, i beated it in every single difficulty it had, each taking more time, obviously. Other than my neck aching in agony from that session, it was a really fun game to play, its obviously not the most advanced game in terms of graphics, but if you are looking for something that runs on a literal potato, and have fun with some friends, its great

Muck: Chaos Speedrun Madness Done Right

Hours Played: 59 (still playing)
Recommended: üëç Absolutely

Started playing Muck just to try it out. Ended up speedrunning it, and somehow got every badge in a single day.
This game looks simple at first ‚Äî then it throws everything at you: Big Chunks, flying nightmares, starvation, and chaos. But that‚Äôs what makes it great.

Every run is fast, messy, and fun. You can go from breaking rocks to fighting gods in minutes. Even after 59 hours, it still hits that perfect balance of stupid fun and actual skill.

Pros:

Pure chaos survival energy

Powerups that change the game every run

Perfect for solo or with friends

Easy to start, hard to master

Cons:

RNG can ruin your day

No save system (pain is part of the fun)

Final Verdict:
Got all badges in one day, still playing anyway.
It‚Äôs that addicting, that chaotic, and that rewarding.

‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt beat Muck ‚Äî you just learn to survive it faster.‚Äù

‚≠ê 10/10 would speedrun Chunk again.
This game somehow managed to grab my attention span. It's pretty challenging at first. However, it's very rewarding understand what to do. Great to play solo and with friends.

So unbalanced it never gives you enough time to do anything before getting obliterated

Awfull and messy game with poor lag optimization. Spawned in and im instantly being attacked by two rock monster thingies (Which proceed to chase me for a good while until finnaly shifting their attention to the crafting bench that the tutorial made me make.) I escape and manage to make some progress. I made an axe and pickaxe and went out to get food, but thats when night hit. 1 or 2 minutes of nonstop agony and annoyance as im ganged up on by five or ten different enemies, each being insanely tanky and hard to hit due to the games poor sensitivity options and whatnot. Managed to survive and got food, then went back, built a furnace and started building a base. Not even a minute later its night again and this time its even worse. I end up dying, with my progress being fully deleted with a game over screen, so much for "Easy mode". I then noticed the creative gamemode, so i jumped into a creative game. Right off the bat, the only difference here was that i wasnt relentlessly pursued by some tanky enemy, at least not yet i wasnt. Everything was peacefull here, despite the eye strain of the awfully colourfull and badly built landscape. Same as last time, tools, food, base... But when i return to camp, i am once again attacked even though it was broad daylight. I died, creative mode my ass. Overall this game needs a heck ton of work. I get its meant to be silly, but it doesnt make it any more of an enjoyable expeirience.

First achievement "Big Mistake" is right. Not a game to be recommended for Solo game players.  Wander too close to enemy mobs and they chase you relentlessly, and come nightfall, will spawn in directly behind you in groups of 2-3, and should you be in combat already, no distinct sound is given to notify you. Current sound notification gets lost in combat noises, making the new mobs appear from nowhere. Day cycle is too short to accomplish any thing of real note. Lastly tutorial is too short before tossing you into the thick of it. Died so many times tryin to figure out how to use the cauldron. Even at its minimalist difficulty without going into 'Creative' mode, this is not a game meant to be played Solo.
